chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph Theodore Trepanier

records.addlTxt:
11:40 AM Defendant Joseph Theodore Trepanier appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Joseph Theodore Trepanier.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Gill indicates possible waiver.   Court addresses DEF, DEF responds.    Attny Gill indicates to proceeds with preliminary hearing.  State calls witness, Detective Jay Poplin, sworn in by court.   State begins examination.   11:54 AM Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State tenders witness.  11:54 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Gill.    Attny Krave no further questions.  11:58 PM Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Gill moves to dismiss, and makes argument.  Court makes response. Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.
Arraignment scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

8:59 AM Defendant Joseph Theodore Trepanier in court, in custody at Sawyer County Jail.  Attorney Cheryl Marie Gill appeared by video for Joseph Theodore Trepanier.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   State makes bond recommendation.  Attny Gill no objection.  Court sets bond.   SIBS $10,000   No Contact with J.L.C.  dob:  7/8/1960   Attny Gill requests preliminary hearing to be set within time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2022 at 11:45 am.
